p: It is also crucial to identify novel anti-HSV lead-compounds with new mechanisms of action. Among natural entities, anthraquinone ( De Logu et al., 2000), terpenoids, polyphenols, phenolics, flavonoids [e.g. houttuynoids ( Houttuynoids, 2012)], proanthocyanidins ( Danaher et al., 2011), geraniin ( Yang et al., 2007a), hippomanin ( Yang et al., 2007b), and excoecarianin ( Cheng et al., 2011) have also shown promising anti-viral activities against HSV ( Khan et al., 2005).
